intro: Leucopogon incisus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained acidic soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Leucopogon incisus is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
